SEARCH
Package model

Class User

java.lang.Object
model.User
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CareerCenterStaff, CompanyRepresentative, Student
public abstract class User extends Object implements Serializable
Abstract base class representing a user in the Internship Placement Management System.

This class implements the inheritance hierarchy for three types of users:

  • Student - can browse and apply for internships
  • CompanyRepresentative - can post internships and review applications
  • CareerCenterStaff - can approve accounts, internships, and process withdrawals

Common Attributes:

  • User ID (unique identifier based on role)
  • Password (default: "password", can be changed)
  • Name and Email
  • User Role

OOP Principles Demonstrated:

  • Abstraction: Abstract class with abstract method getDisplayInfo()
  • Encapsulation: Private fields with getters/setters
  • Inheritance: Base class for Student, CompanyRepresentative, CareerCenterStaff
  • Polymorphism: Subclasses override getDisplayInfo() with specific implementations
Since:
2025-10-14
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
SC2002 Group 6

  • Field Details

    • serialVersionUID

      private static final long serialVersionUID
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • userId

      private String userId
      Unique user identifier. Format varies by role: - Students: U followed by 7 digits and a letter (e.g., U2345123F) - Company Representatives: Company email address - Career Center Staff: NTU account

    • password

      private String password
      User's password for authentication. Default password is "password" for all new users. Should be changed on first login for security.

    • name

      private String name
      User's full name.

    • email

      private String email
      User's email address for communication.

    • role

      private UserRole role
      Role of the user in the system. Determines permissions and available functionalities.

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      protected User()
      Default constructor required for serialization.

    • User

      protected User(String userId, String password, String name, String email, UserRole role)
      Parameterized constructor to create a user with all required fields.
      Parameters:
      userId - unique identifier for the user
      password - user's password
      name - user's full name
      email - user's email address
      role - user's role in the system

  • Method Details

    • getDisplayInfo

      public abstract String getDisplayInfo()
      Abstract method to get a display-friendly representation of the user. Each subclass must implement this method to provide role-specific information.

      Polymorphism: This method demonstrates polymorphism as each subclass provides its own implementation showing relevant user details.

      Returns:
      a formatted string with user details specific to their role

    • changePassword

      public boolean changePassword(String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      Changes the user's password after validating the old password.

      Business Rules:

      • Old password must match current password
      • New password must be different from old password
      • New password must not be null or empty
      Parameters:
      oldPassword - the current password for verification
      newPassword - the new password to set
      Returns:
      true if password was successfully changed, false otherwise

    • validatePassword

      public boolean validatePassword(String password)
      Validates if the provided password matches the user's password.
      Parameters:
      password - the password to validate
      Returns:
      true if password matches, false otherwise

    • hasDefaultPassword

      public boolean hasDefaultPassword()
      Checks if the user is using the default password. Users should be prompted to change default password for security.
      Returns:
      true if user is still using the default password "password"

    • getRoleDisplayName

      public String getRoleDisplayName()
      Gets the role display name for UI purposes.
      Returns:
      the human-readable role name

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares this user to another object for equality. Two users are equal if they have the same userId.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to compare to
      Returns:
      true if the objects are equal, false otherwise

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Generates a hash code for this user based on userId.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash code

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the user.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string containing userId, name, and role
